history: Lakshadweep was formed as a union territory on 1 November 1956. It is known for its coral reefs and pristine beaches.

dishes.name: Breadfruit Curry
dishes.description: A traditional curry made from breadfruit, cooked in coconut milk with spices.

dishes.name: Tuna Fish Curry
dishes.description: A spicy curry made from fresh tuna fish, coconut milk, and local spices.

dishes.name: Coconut Rice
dishes.description: A fragrant rice dish cooked in coconut milk and garnished with grated coconut.

dishes.name: Kadala Curry
dishes.description: A popular curry made from black chickpeas, cooked with coconut, onions, and spices.

dishes.name: Pazham Nurukku
dishes.description: A sweet snack made from ripe bananas, coated with jaggery and fried until crispy.

tourist_places.name: Agatti Island
tourist_places.history: Agatti Island is known for its turquoise lagoons, coral reefs, and white sandy beaches. It offers opportunities for snorkeling, scuba diving, and water sports.

tourist_places.name: Kavaratti Island
tourist_places.history: Kavaratti Island is the administrative capital of Lakshadweep and is known for its pristine beaches, marine life, and water sports activities like kayaking and sailing.

tourist_places.name: Minicoy Island
tourist_places.history: Minicoy Island is the southernmost inhabited island of Lakshadweep. It is famous for its coral reefs, lagoons, and traditional culture.

tourist_places.name: Kalpeni Island
tourist_places.history: Kalpeni Island is known for its picturesque beaches, coral reefs, and the Kalpeni Lighthouse, offering panoramic views of the surrounding islands.

tourist_places.name: Bangaram Island
tourist_places.history: Bangaram Island is a pristine coral island known for its clear turquoise waters, vibrant coral reefs, and rich marine life. It is a popular destination for honeymooners and water sports enthusiasts.
